comment: Strange woman. I would not take her again. She talks a lot about Einstein having Aspbergers. Papers aren't the easiest, you need to be in class every day. However, she is willing to work with you if you are struggling.

This woman is nuts!! She doesn't know what she is talking about half the time.  Her class is not extremely hard, but she is VERY unclear during lectures and NEVER stays on topic. Avoid her if you want to maintain your sanity!!!

Do not take this professor. She is not helpful at all and does not teach the material that is on the tests. Students are responsible for teaching the material to the class. The tests are worded horribly and the material is a mix of content from the book and the presentations. The one research paper is your only chance to get an A in the class.

She is very nice. She uses a sign in sheet. So, if you can get a friend to sign you in then she will never know you weren't there. Four tests. She lectures word for word from a powerpoint. She is grammatically incompetent. If you want to actually have a professor that teaches, choose someone else.

Professor used assigned panel groups to discuss materials.  test were from issues in the bookand presentations.  Must read book/come to class/study materials    Open book test were difficult but will make a good B+.  Need attend class.

This professor did not lecture/teach one time in class. The exams are extremely knit-picky/detail oriented (study the book). She uses student presentations to present the material, but the material is rarely used on the exams. (MAKE SURE YOU BUY THE BOOK)

This teacher is NEVER on topic. She was always behind a chapter for what we completed for homework. She herself was never on time but required us to be there on time and made it 15% our grade. The first day we were assigned a presentation due next class along with 2 papers. Learning is up to you but don't think you'll be prepared for the test.

This teacher doesn't even teach the class! She makes the students present for the class and says that some of the material from the presentation will be on the test. NONE of the presentation material was on the test. Although it is open book, the tests are very difficult. I did not learn a SINGLE thing from her class this semester. Please Avoid!

does not teach at all. she reads off of power points that are online, and gets off topic extremely easily. we never finish going over material before a test. I literally sit down in class, open my book, and start taking my own notes the WHOLE TIME. i have tought myself everything ive learned in her class. scatterbrained, unclear, AVOID THIS TEACHER

She is a complete disaster. She does not lecture and relies on student presentations to teach the class. In other words, she doesn't teach, just sits there and randomly makes comments that don't pertain to the topic. She admits to drinking while grading our papers and tests. Though the exams are open book, everyone still does poorly.
Tests are extremely subjective and the answers are sketchy. Do not take her.

Took her fall 09. Terrible professor. The worst part is, she doesn't even acknowledge that it is her teaching (or lack thereof) that causes students to fail. She tacked an 18 point curve on an exam to make the lowest grade a 50 and the highest a 75. When EVERY SINGLE PERSON fails a test, that should be a major red flag that something isn't right.
I got a 92 in the class and she still gave me a B. She goes by the point system you have to get 700 points which is a 93% to receive an A. Her lack of clarity hurt my GPA. Extremely boring teacher

This class was absolutely ridiculous! A 2 page paper minimum is due EACH class along with an extensive final paper. After an 18 point curve, the highest grade on the first exam was still only a 75. She doesn't teach the class, is extremely unorganized, and often is difficult to understand. It was a struggle to attend class. Terrible professor.

She takes attendance every class and its worth 15 % of your grade. Tests are pretty easy but she is absolutely crazy. She doesn't really talk about anything pertaining to the tests except for the true false questions that she gives you. I would suggest not to take this teacher.

She's ridiculous! She doesn't teach, you can't understand her and her tests make NO sense!! 1st test everyone failed and she made the next open book and people still did poorly. The groups basically teach the class and you have to write a paper that she rips apart then wont give you more than 2 points back on a re-write. Don't take her!!

She is so unorganized and talks about things not related to class. She had to give a HUGE curve on the frist test and that was just to get the highest grade in the class a 74. We pretty much taught ourselves. I HATED THE CLASS and slamed her on her evaulation.... DO NOT TAKE unless it have to!!!!
She's all about her Ph.D., but the class is interesting.

do not take. confusing, confusing, confusing. I don't think she even looks at the chapters before she comes to class. I could teach the class better than her. Her tests were pretty easy though. Just read the book and you should be fine.

Easy class, doesn't take attendence but takes up a note card at each class for a grade. isn't real clear about what's on test... probably would take her again if i had to, but i wouldn't be excited about it.

SCATTER BRAINED OLD WOMAN! She goes on and on about her life; her patients; and her doctorate programs. MAKE SURE YOU DO THE 10 PAPERS; they will def. help you out in the end. especially if lag on the rest of the class. The ten papers and 10 page paper could mean a letter grade or two. So do those and you'll be fine. Take her i guess...

You must write 10 1-2 page papers and one 10 page paper. There are two exams, a midterm and a final. She curves the midterm and does a review but she doesn't do either of those things for the final. She's doesn't make herself clear about anything. She is a terrible teacher. But if you try hard you should be able to make an A.

a very easy A. The class consists of writing 10 papers which are only answering the same 10 questions on an article from the book. two exams, each one she gives gives questions and answers to class prior to exam and then two group presentations and thats it.
